subject: Programming
title: Extreme Programming
description: A fast breakdown of Extreme Programming for builders.

hook.text: Kent Beck took good practices and turned them up to eleven. Pair programming all day. Tests before code.

buildup.text: Extreme Programming introduced TDD, continuous integration, and pair programming as daily practices.

discovery.text: XP's feedback loops were tight: test in seconds, integrate in minutes, release in days.

twist.text: Many teams adopted TDD and CI but skipped pairing. Cherry-picking practices weakened the whole system.

climax.text: XP proved that technical practices matter as much as process. You can't be agile with fragile code.

punchline.text: Good practices taken to extremes produce great software.

quiz.question: What technical practice did Extreme Programming popularize?
